contentfulPagePressRelease.title: NU-Q Recognizes Students Work in Media and Research

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Research and media projects by students at Northwestern University in Qatar (NU-Q) were awarded for excellence at the sixth annual “Media and Research Awards” held in Education City.

The students were recognized and celebrated for their exceptional work in several categories including poetry and prose, journalistic writing, research and analysis, documentary, and multi-media.

The award categories reflect the university’s media, communications and liberal arts programs. The overarching themes were “The Written Word” and “The Image.” Entries were faculty-nominated, and the winners were selected by an independent panel of expert judges from local and international media influencers and outlets, as well as governmental organizations. The competition was stiff with more than 45 nominations for both themes.

Among the judges were Yaser Bishr, Executive Director of Strategy and Development, Al Jazeera; Abdoulaye Diop, Associate Research Professor, Social and Economic Survey Research Center, Qatar University; Dr. Omar El Farouk Boukhris, Director Post Award, Qatar National Research Fund (QNRF); Dr. Claudia Lux, Director, Qatar National Library (QNL); Amal Mohammed Al-Malki, Dean, Translation and Interpretation Institute (TII), Hamad bin Khalifa University (HBKU); Abdullah Baabood, Director, Gulf Studies Center, Qatar University.

“I find this event to be of utmost importance,” said Najlaa Al-Khulaifi, NU-Q Student Union President, class of 2017, communications. “It encourages us to create and grow. We will be adding more opportunities for students to showcase their work and are excited to show the public the caliber of our student work.”
